title: Allergy and Immunizations Clinic Tripler Army Medical Center
description: The official website of Tripler Army Medical Center
cleaned_text: Allergy and Immunizations Clinic Tripler Army Medical Center List of Services Provided - Immunization - Allergy Testing & Immunotherapy - Travel Clinic FLU Vaccination Flu season is upon us. We are concerned about your health and encourage everyone to get vaccinated annually against influenza. It's critical that everyone who is able receives a flu vaccine. It's essential that active duty service members, active duty family members and other beneficiaries are well-protected from influenza. All Beneficiaries can check with their military clinic locations for vaccination availability. Beneficiaries may also go to any Tricare retail network pharmacy to be vaccinated at no cost. Find an eligible pharmacy near you at: [Military Express Scripts](https://militaryrx.express-scripts.com/find-pharmacy) Walk-in hours for routine immunizations Routine immunizations can be accessed on a walk-in basis during the following hours: Monday and Tuesday: 2:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. Wednesday and Friday: 9:30 a.m. - 11:00 a.m. Allergy Shots Allergy shots can be scheduled during the following hours: Monday and Tuesday: 7:30 a.m. - 11:30 a.m. Wednesday and Friday: 12:30 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. Thursday 10:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. Travel Clinic Travel Clinic shots can be accessed during the following hours: Tuesday: 1:00 p.m. - 3:00 p.m. Wednesday: 9:00 a.m. - 11:30 a.m. Friday: 9:30 a.m. - 11:30 a.m. How do I get a flu vaccine? Beneficiary's who not immunized will receive the vaccine with their PCM appointments. Please contact your PCM and schedule an appointment to get your flu vaccine. FAQ's: Q: If I get a flu vaccine elsewhere what do I need to do? A: When you get a flu vaccine from anywhere besides Tripler, follow your Service policy guidance for recording the vaccine in your shot record. You'll need the following information: Q - The date the vaccine was given - The vaccine name or code - Manufacturer - Lot number : If I am unable to get the flu vaccine at Tripler, where else can I go? A : You can visit any participating network pharmacy or TRICARE authorized (civilian) provider. Visit [tricare.mil/flu](http://www.tricare.mil/flu) to learn more. Links [Pediatric Immunizations](/Health-Services/Childrens-Health/Pediatric-Immunizations) We accept customer satisfaction feedback through our FOCUS "For Our Customer's Ultimate Satisfaction" Cards (located throughout the hospital) and through our Interactive Customer Evaluation (ICE) site located on the Internet at [http://ice.disa.mil.](https://ice.disa.mil/index.cfm?fa=site&site_id=51) If you have any questions, you may contact
